info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Schenectady, northern Schoharie and south central Montgomery Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cobleskill, moving east southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Middleburgh, Schoharie, Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Delanson, Central Bridge, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Esperance, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville, Huntersland, Warnerville, Engleville, Gardnersville, Becker Corners and Shutts Corners. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
